comment: The lectures are super pointless to go to, you have to teach yourself the topics. Tests not about anything we learned
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I was lucky to have her. Seriously. Her lectures were memorable and was extremely helpful as long as you were willing to learn.

She is actually so sweet and helpful! She really wants you to pass the class so every test she offers corrections after to earn points back and the last test is a super easy group project. She understands how hard the course especially during the summer and tries her best to work on with you. She's also hellaaa funny.

I had to drop the course after the first few weeks, and it is the best decision I could have made. Her exams were so much different from the coursework and her breakout sessions were more of her talking about random things than actually helping. I do not suggest taking her at all.

A bit racist, but if you can get past it, she gives a ton of extra credit. Black history month, St. Patrick's day, if you fit the category, you get an extra point. Yay, separation by race. Irrelevant political tangents galore.

Grades very late.

She actually does really like physics. Very inspirational, to some aspect. I did good in the class.

She constantly talks about her own personal political opinions more than physics. She's made comments about men that were derogatory, gave out extra points for being black, hispanic, female etc. while she didn't leave anyone out but it was still odd. Take a different prof. She doesn't reply to emails or grade on time so don't expect feedback.
Don't take he

These reviews of her are hilarious, she's not terrible at all as a professor. Yes she likes to ramble but literally don't take her seriously, she's actually very cool. Takes years to respond to emails so don't expect a response back, terrible grader but she does explain things well. Drops one lab!

We always go over time bc she's late to class then yaps for 20 mins about politics and random stuff before getting to material. Doesnt explain labs or explains wrong and then gets mad when we dont understand. Didnt tell us she wanted calcs on a sep sheet of paper until lab 8 then gave us 24 hours to redo everything. We all leave her lab frustrated.

Yes she does ramble at times, but it usually isn't for long and from my experience they were rather entertaining. She made taking the tests very easy with multiple extra credit opportunities, and she gave us an option to change a test to an EASY group project. She does talk about race sometimes which I did not care for, looking past, she's great.
Very very very biased towards students of color and women

Graded all of our labs the day grades were due. Extremely political and made assumptions on who you voted for and treated you that way for the rest of the lab. Terrible at explaining the labs and is just overall bitter.

She is actually awful. She never responds to emails and was not in her office hours the 3 times i've gone. If you like having a study guide or clear way to study, good luck because all you have is the homework which is not like the tests. It's also finals week and she has all of my tests still because she hasnlt graded them yet.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: She is annoyingly political, asked us to vote for extra credit. When I told her I couldn't register, she asked who I supported. I just responded idk because I'm not very political and she assumed I voted for Trump. Later I did a group project and after I spoke she said “Now I see why Trump won,” in front of the whole class implying that I was dumb.
She was a good teacher, but the course overall is just difficult.

Please don't take her, take another professor for physics. She is constantly off topic and does not explain any of the material. You just end up having to look at the textbook for everything. Even her breakout sessions consists of her telling personal stories or not knowing how to use Microsoft whiteboard.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: She is a bad professor. She is constantly late, goes off topic for half the class and is not firendly or treats every student with the same levels of respect. I don't want to say i personally dislike her but her habits in class make it nearly impossible to learn the material sufficiently. You will need to teach yourself the entire class yourself.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: You will indeed have to teach your self by reading the textbook. It's hard to ask questions when you don't even know what to ask or where to start. Goes off topic a lot in class and also shows up late consistently leaving as little as 35 minutes for lecture in which 15 minutes consists of her taking about off topic subjects.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Sarcastic in a bad way. Very disrespectful and thinks she is funny.

The labs aren't hard at all and equations are always provided. There is a lab report every week, but the lowest one is dropped. She graded everything on the last day, which was a bit annoying because you won't know what you got in the class until the last day, but if you did all the lab reports with reasonable effort you should get an A.

Just finished her Physics Lab 1, pretty simple and she is helpful if you have question about the lab, although you really have to problem solve a lot of the equipment that doesn't always work. She's really nice, although I only have 3 of ,y labs graded so far so Im not 100% sure where I stand in the class.

She might come off as kind of impatient or rude if you mess up something in lab, but she isn't actually like that at all; she just wants to make sure you're doing everything correctly. Her grading can get tough and she doesn't grade fast enough to give feedback for future labs. She did give a lot of random extra credit points though.

Absolutely terrible. Currently 2 weeks left in the semester and she has only graded 3 of my labs out of 11. It's tough to continue doing the labs with no feedback. We didn't get our first lab grade until doing 6 labs so you couldn't tell if you were doing them right. In the lab if you forgot to show 1 calculation she takes off 4 points out of 20.

Awful Professor. I was in the hospital passing blood the entire night prior to the test and she did not let me make it up. She told me oh well that it would be dropped and I would just have to deal with it. If you want a teacher that has no sympathy, and doesn't respond to emails. Then you should take this professor.

Not an easy course so you must put in enough effort. To pass the class you must go to breakout sessions and her office hours to ask questions. Lectures during class are the very basic form of getting information so she expected us to read the book before every lecture. She gave lots of extra credit and dropped a lot of grades. I went from F to a B.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: very funny and sweet person but she isn't a good prof, i wouldn't recommend her to anyone. she's kind of bad at explaining things. also, she goes off topic A LOT and takes forever to grade things, she posted most of my grades on D2L on the day final grades were due. do not take this class.

You pretty much have to teach yourself, anything that I learned was based on YouTube videos and I would barely pass the exams. She also doesn't curve grades, she only gives us a week to do corrections.

Exams are 5 questions which class avg was a 45 (I knew a lot of people that got 20-30 on it). Chapter hw is usually 70-80 questions/parts. What you do in class IS NOT what will be on the exam or homework. Loves to brag about making exams hard. Takes about 3 weeks to a month to grade exams.
Her lectures and the homework did not really correlate. I wasn't really understanding her lectures and the first test we took most of the people failed.
